subject: Update pre-built binary packages:
commitMessage:
Update pre-built binary packages:

rpm-* : tizen_macros changed, which can fix gmp build error

add bzip2-devel: which is a package in circle:
 libtool->texinfo->bzip2->libtool
so it should be added to make circle found in time.

Signed-off-by: Zhang Qiang <qiang.z.zhang@intel.com>

comments.message: Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

comments.message:
Patch Set 1:

[ERROR]: Can not find packaging directory in tizen_2.1 branch! Please create one and move all packaging related files, like spec file and changelog, to this directory.

Patch Set 1:

since when is alarm-server, aule and other middleware part of the toolchain?
Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Patch Set 1:

There're many circles even in tizen_main project, for example:

gcc->binutils->gettext->gcc
cmake->curl->c-ares->cmake
aul->privacy-manager-server->aul
libmm-sound->avsystem->pulseaudio->system-server->libfeedback->libmm-sound
app-core->aul->privacy-manager-server->app-core
elementary->app-svc->aul->privacy-manager-server->app-core->elementary
capi-appfw-application->app-core->aul->privacy-manager-server->capi-appfw-application
app-svc->aul->privacy-manager-server->app-core->elementary->app-svc
eglibc->libcap->attr->gettext->gcc->eglibc
alarm-manager->aul->privacy-manager-server->capi-appfw-application->alarm-manager
libmm-session->audio-session-manager->avsystem->pulseaudio->system-server->libfeedback->libmm-sound->libmm-session
pkgmgr->app-core->aul->privacy-manager-server->ui-gadget-1->capi-appfw-app-manager->pkgmgr
notification->aul->privacy-manager-server->capi-appfw-application->notification
rpm->gettext->gcc->eglibc->rpm
tizen-coreutils->gettext->gcc->eglibc->tizen-coreutils
capi-appfw-app-manager->aul->privacy-manager-server->ui-gadget-1->capi-appfw-app-manager
nss->psmisc->gettext->gcc->eglibc->rpm->nss
ui-gadget-1->app-core->aul->privacy-manager-server->ui-gadget-1


So for the pre-built toolchain, we have to put all packages in circles into pre-built.

Patch Set 1:

Circles are:

    gcc->binutils->gettext->gcc
    cmake->curl->c-ares->cmake
    aul->privacy-manager-server->aul
    libmm-sound->avsystem->pulseaudio->system-server->libfeedback->libmm-sound
    app-core->aul->privacy-manager-server->app-core
    elementary->app-svc->aul->privacy-manager-server->app-core->elementary
    capi-appfw-application->app-core->aul->privacy-manager-server->capi-appfw-application
    app-svc->aul->privacy-manager-server->app-core->elementary->app-svc
    eglibc->libcap->attr->gettext->gcc->eglibc
    alarm-manager->aul->privacy-manager-server->capi-appfw-application->alarm-manager
    libmm-session->audio-session-manager->avsystem->pulseaudio->system-server->libfeedback->libmm-sound->libmm-session
    pkgmgr->app-core->aul->privacy-manager-server->ui-gadget-1->capi-appfw-app-manager->pkgmgr
    notification->aul->privacy-manager-server->capi-appfw-application->notification
    rpm->gettext->gcc->eglibc->rpm
    tizen-coreutils->gettext->gcc->eglibc->tizen-coreutils
    capi-appfw-app-manager->aul->privacy-manager-server->ui-gadget-1->capi-appfw-app-manager
    nss->psmisc->gettext->gcc->eglibc->rpm->nss
    ui-gadget-1->app-core->aul->privacy-manager-server->ui-gadget-1

Patch Set 1:

you mean cycles I guess. Those are not cycles, those are wrong dependencies. you should try to track those and fix them.
What is the purpose of this package exactly?

Patch Set 1:

I have checked, take one of it as an example:

  aul->privacy-manager->aul

aul depend on privacy-manager is introduced by this patch:

https://review.tizen.org/gerrit/gitweb?p=framework/appfw/aul-1.git;a=commit;h=8343a2300e5d86e21e6f53497071883d400ccdd2

which is merged on Apr 15 2013.

privacy-manager also depend on aul in commit: 

https://review.tizen.org/gerrit/gitweb?p=framework/security/privacy-manager.git;a=commit;h=0d3e1c3ab2ee329afc40e811981d997d264f9531

They are real API dependency, so I think it's a little hard to remove.

Patch Set 1:

yes, the aul case is known, and fixed in 3.0 btw, but who requires aul in the first place, neither of the package is considered toolchain!!

Patch Set 1: Verified; Looks good to me, approved

This is for tizen_2.1 branch, so we have to add these packages in cycles to pre-built. In this case, if no aul, pivacy-manager will fail caused by missing aul.

For tizen 3.0 (tizen branch), we will reduce this toolchain list, but for tizen_2.1, we have to add these binary packages.
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

Patch Set 1:

Wait a second. pre-built must contain only binary packages that are part of toolchain. None of packages from Main repository must be here.
This repository is not the place to put workarrounds for all cycles.

And pre-built/ must contain only packages that are specified as Support/PreInstall in projectconf, nothing more.
